entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 3) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order imposes, with variations, the restrictions contained in Part III of the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Order 1983 (S.I. 1983/1950) within the infected area described in Schedule 1.

entry.title: The Northern Ireland Arms Decommissioning Act 1997 (Amnesty Period) Order 2001

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Northern Ireland Arms Decommissioning Act 1997 (Amnesty Period) Order 2001

entry.summary: Under section 2(1) of the Northern Ireland Arms Decommissioning Act 1997 (“the Act”) a decommissioning scheme must identify a period during which firearms, ammunition and explosives may be dealt with in accordance with the scheme (“the amnesty period”). Under subsection (2) of section 2, the amnesty period must end before the first anniversary of the day on which the Act was passed or such later day as the Secretary of State may by order from time to time appoint. Under subsection (3) of that section, a day appointed by such an order must not be more than twelve months after the day on which the order was made or more than five years after the day on which the Act was passed. The Act was passed on 27th February 1997.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease Declaratory (Controlled Area) (Scotland) (No. 3) Amendment (No. 2) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order amends the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Declaratory (Controlled Area) (Scotland) (No. 3) Order 2001.

entry.title: The Waste (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (England) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: Section 57 of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 confers on the Secretary of State a power to require waste to be accepted, treated, disposed of or delivered. These Regulations add to the types of waste which may be covered by a direction under section 57. Directions may cover the carcases (or parts of carcases, including blood) of certain types of animal which have been slaughtered as a direct or indirect result of measures taken to deal with foot-and-mouth disease. The relevant types of animal are cattle (if born on or after 1st August 1996), sheep, goats, other ruminating animals and swine. Directions may also be given in relation to ash or rendered material resulting from the incineration or rendering of the carcases (or parts of carcases) of cattle (of any age), sheep, goats, other ruminating animals and swine where such animals have been slaughtered as a result of foot-and-mouth measures.

entry.title: The Social Security (Claims and Information) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations introduce provisions to support the

entry.title: The Social Security (Work-focused Interviews) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the introduction of work-focused interviews in the postcode districts specified in Schedule 1.

entry.title: The Street Trading (2001 Act) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of the provisions of the Street Trading Act (Northern Ireland) 2001 as 1st October 2001.

entry.title: The Employment Appeal Tribunal (Amendment) Rules 2001 (Amendment) Rules 2001
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Employment Appeal Tribunal (Amendment) Rules 2001 (S.I. 2001/1128) by changing the coming into force date of those Rules from 18th April 2001 to 16th July 2001.

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Armorial Bearings) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order authorises Pickering Town Council and Sudbury Town Council to bear and use the armorial bearings formerly borne and used by the Pickering Urban District Council and the corporation of the Borough of Sudbury respectively.

entry.title: The Education (Inspectors of Education and Training in Wales) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order appoints the persons named in the Schedule Her Majesty’s Inspectors of Education and Training in Wales.

entry.title: Street Trading (Fixed Penalty) (Notice and Procedure) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the form of the fixed penalty notice which may be given by an authorised officer of a district council to a person under Schedule 1 to the Street Trading Act (Northern Ireland) 2001. The notice offers the opportunity of discharging (by payment of a fixed penalty to a clerk of petty sessions by a given date) any liability to conviction of the offence under paragraph (a) or (b) of section 21 of the Act as specified in the notice.

entry.title: The Scotland Act 1998 (Modification of Schedule 5) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order makes modifications to Schedule 5 to the Scotland Act 1998 (c. 46). That Schedule is concerned with matters which are outwith the legislative competence of the Scottish Parliament.

entry.title: Street Trading (Form of Licence) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the form of a street trading licence, including its renewal and any variation in the conditions, which may be issued by a District Council authorising a person to trade as a stationary or mobile street trader.

entry.title: The Employment Tribunals (Constitution and Rules of Procedure) (Scotland) (Amendment) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Employment Tribunals (Constitution and Rules of Procedure) (Scotland) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/1170 S. 7) by changing the coming into force date of those Regulations from 18th April 2001 to 16th July 2001.

entry.title: The Employment Tribunals (Constitution and Rules of Procedure) (Amendment) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Employment Tribunals (Constitution and Rules of Procedure) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/1171) by changing the coming into force date of those Regulations from 18th April 2001 to 16th July 2001.

entry.title: The Employment Relations Act 1999 (Commencement No. 8) (Amendment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order amends the Employment Relations Act 1999 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2001 (S.I. 2001/1187 (c. 38)) by changing the coming into force date of the provisions referred to in that Order from 18th April 2001 to 16th July 2001. The provisions concerned are section 41 of, and Schedule 8 to, the Employment Relations Act 1999 (c. 26), which make provision for cases before employment tribunals and the Employment Appeal Tribunal concerning issues of national security.

entry.title: The Disability Discrimination (Taxis) (Carrying of Guide Dogs etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: Section 37 of the Disability Discrimination Act 1995 imposes a duty on taxi drivers to carry, without additional charge a guide dog, hearing dog and other prescribed category of dog when it accompanies the hirer. It also provides that a taxi driver may be exempted from this obligation on medical grounds. The dates on which these provisions come into operation are prescribed by S.R. 2001 No. 163 (C. 10) which was made on 10th April 2001.

entry.title: Road Vehicles Lighting (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations insert a new regulation 11A into the Road Vehicles Lighting Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000, the effect of which is to modify those Regulations in relation to certain passenger vehicles which are the subject of a Department’s approval certificate given pursuant to the Motor Vehicles (Approval) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001.

entry.title: The General Medical Services (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the General Medical Services Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 (“the principal Regulations”), which regulate the terms on which doctors provide general medical services under the Health and Personal Social Services (Northern Ireland) Order 1972.

entry.title: Motor Vehicles (Construction and Use) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicles (Construction and Use) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 (“the 1999 Regulations”) consequentially upon the making of the Motor Vehicles (Approval) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 (“the Approval Regulations”).
